pr_title: [PROF-2002] Change error logging strategy for Uploader

timeline.message:
Change error logging strategy for Uploader

ProfileUploader was logging error as warning with stacktraces.
Now we log the stacktraces in debug mode and log only the exception
message once every 5 minutes minimum in one line.

timeline.bodyText:
This is somewhat unclear:

What's the problem with having logback dependency in test dependencies?
The failure mode here is odd: if I understand this correctly it will not change the log level which will not fail test but will fail coverage reports. Whoever sees this in the future will be puzzled.
timeline.author: mar-kolya

replies.bodyText: Reference directly logback to change log level now
replies.author: jpbempel

timeline.bodyText: Should there be test for debug branch?
timeline.author: mar-kolya

timeline.bodyText: It would be nice to actually check expected behaviour, at least some of it. Maybe using custom appender would be helpful: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29076981/how-to-intercept-slf4j-with-logback-logging-via-a-junit-test
timeline.author: mar-kolya

timeline.bodyText:
Generally speaking this is not a good style - if this is not run then there will be no failure... so this test will not fail if appander is not applied or if things a logged with wrong level...
Instead would you consider saving message in a variable and then assering later in the test? Also maybe mocks could be used for this.
timeline.author: mar-kolya

timeline.bodyText: Maybe you would consider making setupLogger return current log level and using that instead of hardcoding debug here...
